snippet: A review of tens of thousands of documents reveals that sending sensitive information on unclassified computer networks was not limited to Hillary Clinton.
abstract: Review of 30,322 emails sent from Hillary Clinton's private server during her time as secretary of state reveals that sensitive information is routinely sent through unclassified government servers, practice carried out by officials other than Clinton; many officials say unclassified exchanges reflect diplomacy in Internet age, particularly in urgent, rapidly developing situations.

byline.contributor: Matt Apuzzo contributed reporting, and Jeremy Merrill contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A review of tens of thousands of documents reveals that sending sensitive information on unclassified computer networks was not limited to Hillary Clinton.

headline.main: Use of Unclassified Email Systems Not Limited to Clinton
headline.print_headline: Sensitive Email Routinely Sent as Unclassified
